page.title: 17YATTENDON SCHOOL GROUNDS
page.content: In 1984 when reviewing Environmental Studies teachers at the school decided to develop the school grounds as an outdoor resource area; to form an integral part of the curriculum,to provide opportunities for first hand scientific investigation,and to facilitate ecological studies. Included in this plan was the development of a range of habitats and conservation areas, to encourage and support indigenous animal and plant life.As this on-site model has become more established, subsequent studies carried out by pupils in the school grounds have revealed a significant increase in the number of species of flora and fauna. A third year class recorded the following numbers of species {pond life }17,{wild flowers {32, birds}15,{mini-beasts }common lizard and 10 others.
